column5: Well as some of you may know, I was in Costa Rica for the past couple weeks volunteering at a wildlife sanctuary.  I spent my time there assisting with the animals and aiding in the construction of new parts of the sanctuary.  It was hot, and I'll admit this snow sucks, and I dont like being back in it lol.  But we had a blast down there, the animals were fun.  The construction work was exhausting, but we got through it.  We also had a LOT of time to have some fun, and do a bit of fishing.   Mark hauling some wood   Baby anteater that was rescued   one armed monkey, hes a sweetheart   having a bit too much fun   jumping the waterfall in Montezuma  and the fishing ....    first cast   not sure what this is   nice snapper     Overall we caught a lot of snapper and little jacks.  I lost a big tuna and a roosterfish, my equipment wasnt exactly big game equipment, but what ca ya do? we had fun.  The snapper were delcious by the way. Wrapped in banana leaves and cooked over the fire.
Cool stuff Steve.  Volunteering like that is a great way to see the world and  you even got in some fishing to boot, sweet!
Nice trip...looks like the work and play were nicely balanced out...thanks for the report
Looks like you guys had a good time, and had some nice weather.  -Ramble
Steve  What an awesome trip  Looks like you guys had a blast.  I hope that Digi camera was waterproof lol  Hats off to you guys for volunteering your time as well  Cheers  Craig
Nice, looks like a great trip!

I'm envious!!  was supposed to go this year but the budget wouldn't allow it...  again. next year is for certain. any tips for people whom want to travel and fish the area? I'm personally more interested in the deep water stuff for billfish but I would like to get exposed to all the available fishing in CR. I heard there are bonefish there as well.  can you confirm?
I've been to and dived from the same waterfall, it's totally beautiful there.  I'd love to go back again....someday!!  Great pics.
Good on you guys to volunteer your time...cute monkey.  Glad ya came back to enjoy what we all hope is the last of the winter storms.  Any meaning to the tatoo?
thanks for the report. Some great looking pics.
super-cool!
Steve great report! I was wondering how you made out!  I think the fish you are not sure about is a yellow jack. Good eating
That's just great that you would do that Steve, and you were rewarded for your efforts.  Nice fish and that little anteater is such a cutie.  Joey

thanks guys it was a lot of fun.  couldnt afford to go for sailfish, but yes there are LOTS of bonefish .... schools of 20-40 of them, but I couldnt hook one.  Maybe fly fishers would do well for them.  The tattoo is the G.Loomis logo, but its not meant to be like that.  My cousin had the same tattoo and he was killed two years ago, so I got it without hesitation.  Mark just happened to have the same one.

Nice report Steve and what a great way to spend a vacation - volunteering to help a wildlife station.   Good on you.   I had a good friend in the Caribbean or Central America just this past week volunteering with a group of doctors providing medical care.   Sounds like a great trip.
Nice report Steve .Great pics nice of you to volunteer.
Nice pics, 1 week left for whities, lets do it!!!  RY
Awesome trip and pics man. Bet you definately wish you were back there with this storm! We all do!
wish we were there that is.
Wow, sounds like quite the adventure!!  Umm nice tattoos    I got one exactly like it in exactly the same place LOL...
Nice Pics Steve! -your missing all the nice@#$%^%##@@  snow! I really enjoyed Costa Rica, talk soon. Mark
that little anteater is cool.  great pics
I Love Costa,  Great report man.
